trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Jive | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Jive | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Jive with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Jive with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Jive
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Jive

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For more information about this topic, see <link><linkText>Best Practices for Managing the Application access enhancements for Azure Active Directory</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about this topic, see <link><linkText>Best Practices for Managing the Application access enhancements for Azure Active Directory</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Jive.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Jive.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A tenant in Jive
trans-unit.target: A tenant in Jive

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Jive
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Jive

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Jive
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Jive

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Jive.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Jive.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for Jive, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for Jive, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To open the Application Gallery, click Add An App, and then click Add an application for my organization to use.
trans-unit.target: To open the Application Gallery, click Add An App, and then click Add an application for my organization to use.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>What do you want to do?</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>What do you want to do?</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Jive.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Jive.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Jive</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Jive</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Jive, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Jive, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Jive</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Jive</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable user provisioning of Active Directory user accounts to Jive.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable user provisioning of Active Directory user accounts to Jive.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to provide a user security token you need to request from Jive.com.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to provide a user security token you need to request from Jive.com.

trans-unit.source: The following screenshot shows an example of the related dialog in Azure AD:
trans-unit.target: The following screenshot shows an example of the related dialog in Azure AD:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure User Provisioning</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure User Provisioning</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To configure user provisioning, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure user provisioning, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the Jive application integration page, click Configure user provisioning to open the Configure User Provisioning dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the Jive application integration page, click Configure user provisioning to open the Configure User Provisioning dialog.

trans-unit.source: On the Enter your Jive credentials to enable automatic user provisioning page, provide the following configuration settings:
trans-unit.target: On the Enter your Jive credentials to enable automatic user provisioning page, provide the following configuration settings:

trans-unit.source: In the Jive Admin User Name textbox, type a Jive account name that has the System Administrator profile in Jive.com assigned.
trans-unit.target: In the Jive Admin User Name textbox, type a Jive account name that has the System Administrator profile in Jive.com assigned.

trans-unit.source: In the Jive Admin Password textbox, type the password for this account.
trans-unit.target: In the Jive Admin Password textbox, type the password for this account.

trans-unit.source: In the Jive Tenant URL textbox, type the Jive tenant URL.
trans-unit.target: In the Jive Tenant URL textbox, type the Jive tenant URL.

trans-unit.source: The Jive tenant URL is URL that is used by your organization to log into Jive.
trans-unit.target: The Jive tenant URL is URL that is used by your organization to log into Jive.

trans-unit.source: Typically, the URL has the following format: **www.\<html></html>.jive.com**.
trans-unit.target: Typically, the URL has the following format: **www.\<html></html>.jive.com**.

trans-unit.source: Click validate to verify your configuration.
trans-unit.target: Click validate to verify your configuration.

trans-unit.source: Click the Next button to open the Confirmation page.
trans-unit.target: Click the Next button to open the Confirmation page.

trans-unit.source: On the Confirmation page, click the checkmark to save your configuration.
trans-unit.target: On the Confirmation page, click the checkmark to save your configuration.

trans-unit.source: You can now create a test account, wait for 10 minutes and verify that the account has been synchronized to Jive.com.
trans-unit.target: You can now create a test account, wait for 10 minutes and verify that the account has been synchronized to Jive.com.
